## Links to Application

We also provide direct links to our <a target="blank" href="https://montilab.bu.edu/Xposome/">Xposome Portal</a>. This feature allows users to connect information from their web application to our web page.

There are three types of information that users can link to our pages:
<ul>
  <li><span class="highlight-text">Information Page</span> - gives an overview description about the Xposome portal and how to use it, etc.</li>
  <li><span class="highlight-text">Portal Page</span> - enables interactive exploration of expression profiles that were exposed to a panel of known carcinogens based on a given portal</li>
  <li><span class="highlight-text">Moderator Page</span> - allows authorized users to log into the Xposome database (GeneHive) and make changes to the existed screens or to upload new screens onto the portal</li>
</ul>

<script type="text/javascript">

  showPages(id="myPages", dot="informationDot");
  showPages(id="portalPages", dot="portalDot");
  
  function showPages(id, dot) {
    var i;
    var id = String(id);
    var dot = String(dot);
    var slides = document.getElementsByClassName(id);
    var dots = document.getElementsByClassName(dot);
    for (i = 0; i < slides.length; i++) {
      slides[i].style.display = "none";
      dots[i].style.backgroundColor = "#bbb";
    }
    var slideIndex = 0;
    slides[slideIndex].style.display = "block";  
    dots[slideIndex].style.backgroundColor = "#717171";
  }
  
  function clickPages(index, id, dot) {
    var i;
    var id = String(id);
    var dot = String(dot);
    var index = Number(index);
    var slides = document.getElementsByClassName(id);
    var dots = document.getElementsByClassName(dot);
    for (i = 0; i < slides.length; i++) {
      slides[i].style.display = "none";
      dots[i].style.backgroundColor = "#bbb";
    }
    var slideIndex = index;
    if (slideIndex > slides.length) {slideIndex = 1}    
    slides[slideIndex-1].style.display = "block";  
    dots[slideIndex-1].style.backgroundColor = "#717171";
  }
  
</script>
